issues.body:
Repro steps:
1. Sign in with Device Code.
2. Refresh HDInsight node, we will get a list of clusters as below.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32627233/85947091-48b29300-b97b-11ea-8d8c-9cb48aa16415.png)

3. Sign out and re-signin with Azure CLI.
4. Refresh HDInsight node, we will get a list of clusters as below. You can find the clusters are recognized as Reader role cluster.
issues.title: [IntelliJ] HDInsight clusters are false recognized as Reader role cluster if we sign in with Azure CLI

issues.body:
### **Environment:**

- OS: Win 10
- IDE: IC19.3 - jre8
- Plugins Version: Azure java toolkits for IntelliJ 3.38.0

### **Repro Steps：**
1, Open spring boot project
2, Right click your project select Azure -> Deploy to spring cloud
3. New a app name, click ok

### **Actual result:**
Pop up create app dialog again after input app name and click ok 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/63633836/85272170-a8b3b180-b430-11ea-94cc-d32ac729c56b.png)
issues.title: Pop up create app dialog again after input app name and click ok

issues.body:
### Environment:
 - OS: Win 10/Mac 10.15.4
 - IDE: IU19.3 - jre11/IU20.1-jre11
 - Plugins Version: Azure java toolkits for IntelliJ 3.38.0
### Repro Steps：
1. Deploy two apps to azure spring cloud
2. In azure explorer, right click two apps -> Show Properties
3. Switch to the first app properties window
### Actual result:
It cannot refresh to the right page
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46642771/84734274-1300c800-afd3-11ea-9440-c3cdf64d38f2.png)
issues.title: Cannot refresh after switch app properties window

issues.body:
### Environment:

- OS: Win 10/Mac 10.15.4
- IDE: IU19.3 - jre11/IU20.1-jre11
- Plugins Version: Azure java toolkits for IntelliJ 3.38.0

### Repro Steps：

### Actual result:

issues.body:
### Environment:
 - OS: Win
 - Plugins Version: Azure java toolkit for IntelliJ: 3.37.0
 - IDE Version: IU2020.1.1 - jre11
### Repro steps:
1. Right click project -> Azure -> Push image
2. Fill in blank with right format
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46642771/84364945-5c33cf00-ac03-11ea-954b-62a386f6254d.png)

3. Apply and run
### Result:
#### Push image:
Can excute run, build image and error when push to acr

#### Run on web app for containers
Same repro steps as Push image, but sign in with no-subs  account
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46642771/84365093-88e7e680-ac03-11ea-8c3d-e9b2b5d2ca4c.png)
It can execute run, build image and error when push to acr
issues.title: Can execute run with wrong parameters and empty subs in dialog

issues.body:
This is a compatibility issue.
This issue only occur in eclipse 2019-12, when installing new software in eclipse 2019-09, this issue not happen.

### Environment:

- OS: Windows10/Mac
- Azure java toolkit for Eclipse: 3.20.0
- Eclipse: 2019-12
- JDK: oracle jdk8

### Repro steps:

1. Right-click a web app and choose Show Properties
2. Click on Get Publish Profile button
3. Choose where you want to save the profile

### Result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/71349924-1595de00-25ab-11ea-8fba-c1484659586a.png)

However, Publish profile saved in the local system
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/71350108-83420a00-25ab-11ea-8975-00949592bfb1.png)

### Expect:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/71350419-40ccfd00-25ac-11ea-9ec4-0adaadab5d2f.png)

JDK: Oracle JDK8/11

### Steps:

1. Click "View Template File" button
2. Return to the properties view

### Result:
this issue not stable reproduce on Mac

issues.title: Properties view UI issue

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Fix run into exception when submit job to aris cluster issue (#3238)

* Fix submit job to aris cluster error issue(#3208)
* Fix faield to submit job to aris cluster due to duplicate session name issue
* Fetch yarn log for Aris Spark job

issues.body:
### Environment:

1. OS: Windows10/Mac/Linux
2. IntelliJ 2019.1.x/2018.3.x
3. Bits: PR/3491
4. JDK: Oracle JDK8/11

### Reproduce Step:
1. Deploy a web app on Azure and enable app service log feature.
2. Start streaming logs of this web app.
3. Turn off web server logging on the portal after connecting to log-streaming service.

### Result:
Plugin disconnects from log-streaming service automatically.
But click start streaming logs to start again now, it still can connect to log stream service successfully.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/59667567-8a95ee80-91e9-11e9-880d-2ee777b425e5.png)
issues.title: Still can connect to log streaming after turn off web app streaming log on portal

issues.body:
### Environment:
1. Eclispe: 2018-12 (4.10.0)
2. JDK: 1.8
3. Bits: dev944


### Behavior:
First, make sure you have at least two Web Apps
1. Delete one app service (e.g monawarwin33) in Deploy to Web App dialog, after deleting, the web app list in Azure Explorer will not auto-refresh.
2. Delete another web app (e.g. monajarwin111) in Azure Explorer, open deploy to Web App dialog, you will find the deleted web app still exist.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/53479288-aa2acf00-3ab3-11e9-97cf-a58f04c43b96.png)
issues.title: Can't auto refresh web app

issues.title: [IntelliJ][ReportedByUser] Uncaught Exception  java.lang.RuntimeException: com.microsoft.azure.hdinsight.sdk.common.SparkAzureDataLakePoolServiceException:

issues.body:
Bits: 3.17.0

### Environment:
1. IntelliJ in global environment
2. An ACR with the repository has more than 30 tags

### Steps:
2. Right-click an ACR and choose Open ACR Explorer.
3. Right click the repository to show tags 

### Behavior:
Before: show all tags in the current page and the action button: previous page and next page are disabled.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/50672599-28b74300-1014-11e9-9956-8c5a72328cdc.png)

Now: the tag page has a paging function and the default size is 30. 
**Bug:** The next page button doesn't work, click it cannot turn to the next page.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/50673398-42f32000-1018-11e9-8a2d-7db9452c8088.png)
issues.title: ACR Explorer -> The tag next button cannot turn to the next page

issues.title: [IntelliJ][ReportedByUser] MS Azure Explorer - Error Loading Container Registries

issues.body:
It is not a regression issue, it also repro in previous version.

Build: 864

Repro steps:

1. Right-click a web project choose Azure-Libraries Configuration
2. Click add
2. Click the "help" button in add library window

Result:

There is nothing shows up. I think it should open a page to display some info.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28860891/48769637-1c428980-ecf7-11e8-8a9d-432af8391efe.png)
issues.title: Click the "help" button in add library window, nothing shows up

issues.body:
1. Put following string into `C:\Users\<username>\AzureToolsForIntelliJ\AadProvider.json`
```
{
    "EnableDeviceLogin": true
}
```
2. Sign in with device code

issues.title: [IntelliJ] Find error in idea.log when Log in with device code

issues.body:
Build: PR 2478

Repro Steps:
1. From a cluster context menu, click "Submit Job"
2. Click "Apply" to save the config file

Result:
Could not select the config file from "Edit configuration" toolbar.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36756024/48467491-f130d500-e7e0-11e8-8034-221741e94617.png)

issues.title: [IntelliJ][ReportedByUser] MS Services - Error Getting Subscriptions

issues.body:
The Azure Intellij Idea plugin seems to be broken.

It will not sign into Azure. When choosing either sign-in method, the sign-in proceeds results in an endless loop, with no ability to cancel the dialog.

It's stuck here: https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/storage/attachments/45350-annotation.png

I tried on the latest Idea release (full version) on two Windows machines and a Ubuntu 18.04 setup.

This should be a P0 issue. Please let me know what you need from me to help get to the root cause.

thanks,

Tobias Weisserth
issues.title: Intellij Idea Azure plugin broken, won't sign in, gets the application stuck

issues.body:
Build: 819

Repro steps:

1. Deploy a project to webapp1
2. Delete webapp1, but not in the current window
3. Back to this window and select run on webapp 
4. Select webapp1 and check deploy to slot option

Result:

When it try to get slot data, you will get an error as below:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28860891/47493538-19808000-d882-11e8-8a4b-d1c424c7c855.png)

I think the web app list should be refreshed automatically each time when user open the run on web app window.

issues.body:
This issue isn't stable and easy to repro, it is highly repro on the first time refresh after opening IntelliJ window, maybe you can encounter it by following steps:

Repro Steps:
1. Install plugin Azure Toolkits for IntelliJ 
1. Sign in 
1. Refresh Web App node in Azure Explorer


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46655529-6b68ab00-cbde-11e8-8d2b-d1bc31a6da4a.png)
issues.title: The Web App name displayed in Azure Explorer is incomplete

issues.body:
Build used: Daily536

Repro steps:
1. Right-click a web project-> Azure -> Run on Web App
2. Deploy to a new Windows Web App
3. After deployment, create deployment-slots on portal with below configuration source
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46653530-e29b4080-cbd8-11e8-9315-2f2629ca4260.png)
4. Right-click the web project again and deploy to this slot: slot1

Result:
Always fails with error message: FTP client can't store the artifact, reply code: 550.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46653561-fcd51e80-cbd8-11e8-882a-bcbd7d2ecca0.png)

Try creating a slot with production configuration source, then can deploy to this slot successfully
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46654104-7de0e580-cbda-11e8-907f-004c65cead42.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46653726-648b6980-cbd9-11e8-8ef4-63bf8886bc98.png)

By design?
issues.title: Can't deploy to an war Windows type deployment slot without production configuration resource

issues.body:
The issue also repro in previous marketplace version, so it is not a regression issue.
OS: Win/Mac

Reproduce steps
1. In a IntelliJ window, open a project and publish as a docker container.
2. Click link "published" in Azure Activity Log dialog, it will navigate to the right URL
3. Open another project in a  new IntelliJ window, and publish as a docker container too.
4. Click link "published" in Azure Activity Log dialog, it will also navigate to the right URL

Result:
Now, click link "published" in step 2 Azure Activity Log dialog again, it will navigate to the URL of step 4.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/46243074-5e8bd080-c402-11e8-8d26-a8c923822e27.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41051257/46243080-6f3c4680-c402-11e8-9500-0c30358ec75b.png)
issues.title: Open wrong published link if has published link in two InteliiJ window

issues.body:
@SummerSun  saw several incorrect dependencies in hdinsight-node-common, the correct groudId should be `com.fasterxml.jackson.module`.

```xml
<exclusion>
    <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson.core</groupId>
    <artifactId>jackson-module-scala_2.11</artifactId>
 </exclusion>
```

Builds used:
artifacts/azure-toolkit-for-intellij.2017.405.05-01-2017.zip.
artifacts/WindowsAzurePlugin4EJ.410.05-01-2017.zip.

Repro steps:
Open Eclipse/IntelliJ
Sign in Azure (Both Interactive and Automated can be reproduced)
Right click **Azure** and choose **Refresh**
After refresh, right click **Azure** and choose **Select Subscriptions**
Refresh subscriptions in the subscriptions dialog

IntelliJ

Version:  IntelliJ 2017.1.2
Build used: artifacts/azure-toolkit-for-intellij.2017.385.04-27-2017.zip

The issue will be stable reproduced when the first time of azure Sign in.
Repro steps:

1. Open IntelliJ
2. Right click **Azure** and choose **Sign in**
3. Select  **Interactive** 
4. After sign in, right click **Azure** and choose **Sign out** 

The error dialog box appears.

issues.body: We get a NullPointerException at dockerVM.storageAccountName = vm.storageProfile().osDisk().vhd().uri().split("[.]")[0].split("/")[2]; in AzureDockerVMOps because vhd() is null for a vm with managed disk. So AzureDockerVM does not get added to the list. Should work with managed disk correctly.

issues.body:
This is on Windows 10 when the user has the Android Plugin checked and we are throwing the retrofit error. The issue here though is that if we do throw some exception we should not block the rest of the Idea from working properly (in this case general settings window can't be opened). 

There is a work around which requires the user to click on the "red" exclamation icon on the bottom of the IntelliJ and disable Azure plugin and restart.

issues.title: Unable to sign out Azure normally
issues.body:
Sometimes, this issue can stable repro, sometimes not.
### Environment:
* OS: Windows/Linux
* Eclipse: 2018-12 (4.10.0)
* Bits: dev998

### Steps:
1. Right-click `Azure `in Azure explorer and choose `Sign In`
2. Select `Automated `method, then `Browse...` or `New ...`
3. Right-click `Azure `and choose `Refresh`
4. After refreshing, right-click `Azure `in Azure explorer and choose `Sign Out`
5. Click `Yes`  in the pop-up dialog box.

Result:

- Can't sign out directly but trigger refresh behavior on Docker Hosts and Web App nodes, shown as below
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/53549172-7f518100-3b6e-11e9-9a43-6b9a682b3887.png)

- Then pop up a error dialog
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/53549234-a90aa800-3b6e-11e9-9913-e442fa51b65d.png)

- Sign out again, click `Yes`, sign out successfully
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/53549249-b1fb7980-3b6e-11e9-9b9c-a3b044b50049.png)

### Environment:
* OS: Windows/Mac/Linux
* Eclipse: 2018-12 (4.10.0)
* Bits: dev995

issues.title: [IntelliJ][ReportedByUser] Provision Spark Resource Pool, AU computing issue(is 0): Uncaught Exception  java.lang.IllegalStateException: Exception thrown on Scheduler.Worker thread. Add `onError` handling.

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
No element <listener> be added when enabling the telemetry with AI in Eclipse #2150 (#2796)

- Fix issue #2796 2150
- Add workaround for application insight sdk. Add a listener in web.xml

issues.title: No element <listener> be added when enabling the telemetry with AI in Eclipse
issues.body:
Steps:

1. Right-click a web dynamic project -> Azure -> Configure Application Insights...
2. Enable telemetry with Application Insights

Result:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46645070-a3a7c380-cbb5-11e8-84ad-0ce579c80ad6.png)

Expect(screeshot from IntelliJ plugin):
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/46645075-a86c7780-cbb5-11e8-8911-eb8449e0c32e.png)

Build: Daily534
OS: Windows/Mac/Linux

Repro steps:
1. Create a web project
2. Right-click project and configure the AI
[how to configure application insight in IntelliJ]( https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/WPTFundamental/_layouts/OneNote.aspx?id=%2Fteams%2FWPTFundamental%2FShared%20Documents%2FAAPTServicing%2FAAPT%20Webtools%20Offshore%20Current%20Release&wd=target%28Java%20Tools%2FAzure%20Java%20Toolkits%2FAzure%20java%20toolkits%28IDE%5C%29-manual.one%7C7FAF569A-EA05-4B92-957A-626D02B04207%2F%5BIntelliJ%5DConfigure%20Application%20Insights%7C7A05FB47-67D3-4421-ACD0-46833E70E0FB%2F%29onenote:https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/WPTFundamental/Shared%20Documents/AAPTServicing/AAPT%20Webtools%20Offshore%20Current%20Release/Java%20Tools/Azure%20Java%20Toolkits/Azure%20java%20toolkits(IDE)-manual.one#%5bIntelliJ%5dConfigure%20Application%20Insights&section-id={7FAF569A-EA05-4B92-957A-626D02B04207}&page-id={7A05FB47-67D3-4421-ACD0-46833E70E0FB}&end   )
3. Run the application
4. Stop the running process after the artifact is deployed successfully

issues.body:
Build: Develop731
OS: Windows/Mac/Linux


Repro steps:

1. Right click on the project and select "Publish as Azure Web App"
2. Click the "Create" button
3. Fill in some values and click the "Create" button in the "Create Application Service" dialog

Result:
**For Global:**
1. The app service list in Deploy Web App dialog box does not automatically display the new app service after it is created, but in Azure Explorer, the web app node will auto-refresh after creation and display the new app service.
2. Click the "Refresh" button Deploy Web App dialog box and still not display the new app service
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/45618105-38cc0680-baa7-11e8-9689-f97f325bfc0d.png)

Occasionally there will be one or two successful creations and auto-refresh cases

**For Azure China**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22470312/45618315-dc1d1b80-baa7-11e8-8c8c-f6279bfaaefb.png)

Only for IntelliJ

There are three account kind in Storage Account dialog, two of them have same name: Blob storage
Before version only has two account kind: General purpose and blob storage 
Now:

Before:

Issue2:
Using these account types to create storage accounts, I find that the general purpose account have the same configuration with the first blob storage type account

issues.title: Duplicate account type for storage account

issues.body:
Build: develop#700
Steps:
1. Right-click a web project and select Azure-> Configure Application Insights...
2. Check `Enable telemetry with Application Insights`
3. Select an AI in the Instrumentation key list(you can create an AI before)
4. Click OK

2. Clicked on Select Subscriptions button from Azure Explorer
3. Got exception:
